lead_paragraph: Sixteen months after ground was broken, a plan by a Chinese billionaire that would link the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans and greatly alter a country is shrouded in mystery and controversy.

byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

headline.print_headline: Lost in Nicaragua, a Chinese Tycoon’s Canal Plan
headline.main: Lost in Nicaragua, a Chinese Tycoon’s Canal Project

snippet: Sixteen months after ground was broken, a plan by a Chinese billionaire that would link the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans and greatly alter a country is shrouded in mystery and controversy.
abstract: Chinese billionaire Wang Jing broke ground in December 2014 for world's biggest canal across Nicaragua, but project has languished amid mystery and heated protests in country; growing number of critics say potential negative aspects of 170-mile-long canal overshadow positive.
